author: donschoe
content: I think we need to differ between long-standing testnets and stresstest environments. now that mainnet is launched, pyrmont serves as testbed for every user who wants to check their hardware, setting up their nodes, and trying out to validate for the first time before attempting to validator on mainnet. at this point, "breaking" pyrmont should be avoided, rather, it should be running as smoothly as mainnet ideally. if something goes wrong on pyrmont, it could be an indicator for incoming issues on mainnet. if we, however, break it on purpose, we might lose this indicator. at this point, such tests should be outsourced to other testnets if possible.
